parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> High Command

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns group's [[High Command|high command]] commander.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''hcLeader''' group

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> group: [[Group]] -

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_leader = [[hcLeader]] groupName;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[High Command]], [[hcAllGroups]], [[hcGroupParams]], [[hcRemoveAllGroups]], [[hcRemoveGroup]], [[hcSelected]], [[hcSelectGroup]], [[hcSetGroup]], [[hcShowBar]], [[hcShownBar]], [[onHCGroupSelectionChanged]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 2, 2009</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Dimitri Harkov|Dimitri Harkov]] <dd class="note">[[hcLeader]] returns 'NULL_OBJECT' if you use it on your HC commander's group in a HC setup with subordinates. It seems to work as expected if you don't use subordinates.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
